str2: And, even, also, namely.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lawless, wicked, without law. (by implication, a Gentile), or (positively) wicked.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To uncover, bring to light, reveal. From apo and kalupto; to take off the cover, i.e. Disclose.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and haireomai; to take up, i.e. Adopt; by implication, to take away, i.e. Abolish, murder.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wind, breath, spirit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Appearing, manifestation, glorious display. From epiphanes; a manifestation, i.e. the advent of Christ.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the present participle of pareimi; a being near, i.e. Advent; physically, aspect.
